titleStmt.title: Thomas McKinster to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG12012

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 37th - 76th Regiments Enrolled Militia Primary Source Documents (1861-1866)

body.p:
August 20 1865
Louisa Kentucky
Thos E Bramlett
Gov of Ky }
Frankfort
Honored Sir

According to a Resolution of the Past past Ledgislature of Ky. To pay the counties of Lawrence & Boyd for 35 days service under a call from you that we was not paid for. If so, you will confer a favor upon us_ by sending a Paymaster & Mustering officers at once, or, let us send our PayMaster out to Frankfort and get pay Rolls & Mustering Rolls. An answer to the above would relieve me of much annoyance. I wrote to the Insp.. Genl of Ky.. (Mr Hays) and he has Intreated our inquires with silent contempt so far.
I trust I have the honor to remain your humble servant
Thos M Kinster Ex.. Col.. 68. Regt E. M.

68 E. M.
Louisa Ky
Aug 20 1865
Field & Staff
McKinster Thomas
Ex Col 68 Regt E. M.
To the Gov

Desires information in regard to the act passed by the Legislature for the benefit of the E. M. of the Counties of Lawrence & Boyd, says send pay master & Mustering officer at once, or let us send our pay master to Frankfort & get the pay rolls & mustering rolls Has written to Insp Gen, Hays but he treated our inquires with silent contempt
